source.95e0d2ca:
fig = px.scatter(data, x="Year", y="Entity", 
                 color="Year",
                 size='Year', 
                 hover_data=['Annual CO₂ emissions (tonnes )', 'Code'], 
                 title = "CO2 Emissions")
fig.show()
source.1cbce6b5:
fig3 = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter(
    y = data['Entity'],
    mode='markers',
    marker=dict(
        size=16,
        color=data['Year'], #set color equal to a variable
        colorscale='Viridis', # one of plotly colorscales
        showscale=True
    )
))
fig3.show()
source.cb7c79a3: Guys, we all know CO2 is incresing day by day in our enviornment due to lack of trees. So this dataset we are going to analyze CO2 emission in enviornment. This is also a  major issue in our enviornment nowadays. Coming to the part of [Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/yoannboyere/co2-ghg-emissionsdata) it is csv file consists different countries and their CO2 emmision in the enviornment.
